Supervising Officer - Finance Job at KPMG




        
    

        
        KPMG is a global network of independent professional services firm with deep expertise in the provision of audit, tax and advisory services to clients in various industries and sectors of the economy. The Firm is well represented in Nigeria and across the African continent, with the objective of providing exceptional and quality services to multinational, regional and local clients and to enhance the product offerings in certain previously under-serviced markets.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Supervising Officer - Finance

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-tim

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are currently hiring Supervising Officers in our Finance Managed service line. Please see below details.


Requirements
Qualifications:    


	A First Degree or equivalent in Accounting, Finance, Economics or a Business-related discipline.
	Qualified (or student member at the final stage of qualification) with a recognised professional accounting body (ICAN, ACCA, CIMA).


Experience and technical knowledge:


	Minimum of four (4) years of industry/or consulting experience working in an accounting/ finance-related position.
	Knowledge of accounting fundamentals, concepts and conventions as well as bookkeeping principles.
	Strong technical knowledge, understanding, application and interpretation of relevant International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS)
	Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office suite particularly Excel.
	Working knowledge of accounting software and ERP.
	Specific knowledge of key processes involved in any of the following:
	
		Accounts receivable management and revenue recognition
		Accounts payable management and cost accounting
		Treasury operations
		Accounts preparation and consolidation
	
	
	Good understanding of treasury and other financial management-related concepts.


Skills and personal attributes:


	Ability to lead and coordinate team members effectively to accomplish tasks and achieve objectives.
	Ability to effectively articulates ideas and updates to key management personnel
	Must be a self-driven, results-oriented individual with the ability to work independently and deliver outcomes effectively.
	Excellent interpersonal skills with proven ability to collaborate.
	Quantitative, attention-to-detail, problem solving and analytical skills.
	Good verbal and written communication skills
	Ability to demonstrate commitment to ethical standards and high level of integrity.
	Ability to research, read, comprehend and critically examine accounting standards and other pronouncements in order to have an informed point of view
	Personal drive and positive work ethic to deliver results within tight deadlines and in demanding situations without compromising on quality and ethical standards and values.
	Ability to challenge existing practices to develop answers to complex issues.

Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Credit / Finance

	Our client, a fast-growing fintech company committed to delivering innovative digital financial solutions, is seeking a proactive and results-driven Loan Recovery Officer to support effective credit management and loan repayment performance.
	This role is responsible for managing loan recovery activities, engaging customers on repayment obligations, and implementing recovery strategies that minimize default risk while maintaining positive customer relationships.


Key Responsibilities


	Follow up with clients on due and overdue loan repayments through calls, messages, and physical visits where necessary.
	Maintain accurate records of loan accounts, payment schedules, and collection activities.

	Ensure timely recovery of loans while maintaining professional and respectful customer relations.

	Minimum of OND / HND / Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, or a related field.
	Prior experience in loan collection, credit control, or customer service is an advantage.
	Strong communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work independently and meet collection targets.
	High level of integrity, professionalism, and attention to detail.

Front Desk Officer Job at Ikeja Electricity Distribution Company Plc (IKEDC)




        
    

        
        Ikeja Electricity Distribution Company (IKEDC) is one of the largest power distribution companies in Nigeria, committed to delivering reliable and efficient electricity services to our customers. With a strong focus on innovation and sustainability, we aim to transform the energy landscape in Nigeria and contribute to the country's economic development. Our mission is to provide exceptional service while ensuring the safety and well-being of our employees and customers.
     

            
    



At Ikeja Electric, we don’t just power homes and businesses – we power careers. As a leading energy provider, we are committed to fostering a culture that champions integrity, innovation, and excellence. Our team is the heartbeat of our success, and we thrive on collaboration, continuous improvement, and creating a workplace where everyone can shine.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Officer

Job Location: Lagos

Role Purpose


	To answer phones, greet customers and clients, scheduling appointments, verifying identification and signing in guests, opening and closing the establishment, and acting as a liaison between clients and staff


Role Accountabilities


	Answering and routing of internal and external calls
	Mail distribution (arranging incoming and outgoing mails/packages with ccouriers)
	Taking messages and relaying them to the relevant department/organisation and providing feedback as required
	Handling correspondence and ensuring that confidentiality is maintained at all times especially when dealing with sensitive information
	Administration of meeting rooms: ensure meeting rooms are properly kept and all appliances in the area maintained
	Managing front desk concierge i.e., flight bookings and reservations and must be able to effectively manage last minute bookings, reservations and cancelations.
	Vendor management: processing payment for airlines, travel agents, hotels etc and ensuring their involves are sent and payments processed in a timely manner
	Ensuring visitors and guests on the premises are properly attended to
	Accepting packages and liaising with visitors.
	End to end organisation and planning of HR & Admin or company events
	Any other task assigned by the Team Lead or Head of Admin or the CHRAO


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree or its equivalent in English, Business Administration, Information Science, Languages, or related discipline.
	A minimum of 0-2 years of relevant experience


Skills and Competencies:


	Front Desk Administration
	Administrative Support
	Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, & PowerPoint) .
	Customer Centricity
	Risk Management
	People Leadership
	Entrepreneurship
	Organizational Learning
	Change Management


Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted
